column4: i wouldnt need to automount it always at the same mount point would i?
mine gets mounted to /media/EXTERNAL no matter where I plug it in.
i find out the blkid and then use that to make an entry into fstab
what if you boot with an external drive connected?
it will show up in "places" but not be automounted
what if you used mine? without having used it before? :)
point is.. the places menu autodetects drives (internal + external) just fine. so why bother with mountpoints?
if you can just set a flag and have everything automounted according to its label.
if i want my external drive to get mounted always on mount point /media/Backup irrespective of which usb port i plugged it in
but I never bothered with mountpoints or USB ids. just that one flag
i am not facing the issue here
